main event: A civilian observed a bright, steady, reddish object that seemed to be accelerating in height over Oak Grove, Oregon.
interesting points: The object moved to the east and disappeared from view.
The observer looked for the object for quite some time but could not locate it again.
The weather conditions at the time included clear skies with some clouds, surface winds around 13-45 knots, and a cloud ceiling of 25,999 feet.
A weather balloon was released from the Salem Weather Station around the time of the sighting.
The report was prepared by the Combat Intelligence NCOIC at Headquarters ROADS, and a weather forecaster believed the weather balloon could have been in the approximate location of the sighting.
